Sequence Information.Family: Belongs to the scorpion NDBP 9 family
Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.27912176] Gram-negative bacteria:Pseudomonas aeruginosa (ATCC 27853)(MIC=3.12μmol/L);Escherichia coli (D31)(MIC=50μmol/L);Serratia marcescens (ATCC 4112)(MIC=3.12μmol/L);Gram-positive bacteria:Micrococcus luteus (A270)(MIC=25μmol/L);Staphylococcus aureus (ATCC 29213)(MIC=50μmol/L);Staphylococcus epidermidis (ATCC 12228)(MIC=50μmol/L);Fungi:Candida albicans MDM8(MIC=50μmol/L);Candida tropicalis (IOC 4560)(MIC=12.5μmol/L);Cryptococcus neoformans(MIC=12.5μmol/L)
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: [Ref.27912176] MHC=25μmol/L against human red blood cells
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: No cytotoxicity information found in the reference(s) presented
Sequence Information.Structure Description: The peptide adopts Helical fraction 0.02  in water;0.15 in TFE/Water;0.17 in POPC;0.20 in POPC:POPG;0.24 in POPC:DOPE;
Sequence Information.Function: Antibacterial activity against the Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria and fungi. It showed a diminished antimicrobial activity against all the microorganisms tested, besides that it did not present activity at the range of concentrations analyzed against Escherichia coli SBS 363, E. cloacae, Bacillus subtilis, C. parapsilosis, A. niger and C. herbarum.

Literature.Title: Novel designed VmCT1 analogs with increased antimicrobial activity.
Literature.Author: Pedron CN, Torres MT, Lima JADS, Silva PI, Silva FD, Oliveira VX.

Literature.Title: novel designed VmCT1 analogs with increased antimicrobial activity
